intro: Oxytropis oreophila var. oreophila, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations. Oxytropis oreophila var. oreophila is adapted to cold, arid environments and is an important component of alpine ecosystems.
